Non admin users don't have an "Artifacts" tab. It sucks a bit;

FYI, here is the [link](https://circle-artifacts.com/gh/nilearn/nilearn/1421/artifacts/0/home/ubuntu/nilearn/doc/_build/html/index.html).
You can compare with current [master](https://circle-artifacts.com/gh/nilearn/nilearn/1414/artifacts/0/home/ubuntu/nilearn/doc/_build/html/index.html).

It doesn't look like there is a strong agreement on whether e.g. should be followed by a comma or not, see for example [this](http://www.dailywritingtips.com/comma-after-i-e-and-e-g/).

I would leave it like it was previously.

text:
> There is no formal rule, I agree, except consistency

My 2 cents: consistency about this kind of things is very hard if not impossible to maintain in the long run and the benefit/cost ratio of maintaining it is very low.
title: (84, '', u'doc/manipulating_images/data_preparation.rst')

text: I agree with @lesteve : I am almost always in favor of consistency, but for things like this, the benefit is very small.
